body:
kubectl version: 1.11.3
helm version: 2.11.0

With k8s version 1.11 pod security policy mechanism has been introduced.

Due to `USER NOBODY` in Dockerfile (https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/master/rootfs/Dockerfile) after `helm init` I'm getting for tiller pod:
`kubectl -n mytestnamespace describe pod | grep Events -A 20`
```
Events:
  Type     Reason     Age               From               Message
  ----     ------     ----              ----               -------
  Normal   Scheduled  18s               default-scheduler  Successfully assigned mytestnamespace/tiller-deploy-74bdf5fc67-4626p to node3
  Normal   Pulled     5s (x3 over 18s)  kubelet, node3     Container image "gcr.io/kubernetes-helm/tiller:v2.11.0" already present on machine
  Warning  Failed     5s (x3 over 18s)  kubelet, node3     Error: container has runAsNonRoot and image has non-numeric user (nobody), cannot verify user is non-root
```

It works properly when particular PSP is defined however I do not like:
- "RunAsAny"
- "privileged: true"
- "allowPrivilegeEscalation: true"
- "allowedCapabilities"

The whole, minimal perm policy here:

`kubectl get psp tiller -o yaml`:
```
apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: PodSecurityPolicy
metadata:
  name: tiller
spec:
  allowPrivilegeEscalation: true
  allowedCapabilities:
  - CAP_SETUID
  fsGroup:
    rule: RunAsAny
  privileged: true
  runAsUser:
    rule: RunAsAny
  seLinux:
    rule: RunAsAny
  supplementalGroups:
    rule: RunAsAny
  volumes:
  - configMap
  - emptyDir
  - projected
  - secret
  - downwardAPI
  - persistentVolumeClaim
```

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: bug

title: tiller and PSP: container has runAsNonRoot and image has non-numeric user (nobody), cannot verify user is non-root
